lustre/tests/memhog.c

00034 
00035 #include <sys/types.h>
00036 #include <unistd.h>
00037 #include <stdio.h>
00038 #include <stdlib.h>
00039 
00040 #define CHUNK (128 * 1024)
00041 
00042 void usage(const char *prog, FILE *out)
00043 {
00044         fprintf(out, "usage: %s allocsize\n", prog);
00045         fprintf(out, " allocsize is kbytes, or number[KMGP] (P = pages)\n");
00046         exit(out == stderr);
00047 }
00048 
00049 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00050 {
00051         long long kbtotal = 0, kballoc;
00052         int i, j, k, numchunk, alloc, sum, rc = 0;
00053         char **mem, *tmp;
00054 
00055         if (argc == 2) {
00056                 char *end = NULL;
00057                 kbtotal = strtoull(argv[1], &end, 0);
00058 
00059                 switch(*end) {
00060                 case 'g':
00061                 case 'G':
00062                         kbtotal *= 1024;
00063                 case 'm':
00064                 case 'M':
00065                         kbtotal *= 1024;
00066                 case '\0':
00067                 case 'k':
00068                 case 'K':
00069                         break;
00070                 case 'p':
00071                 case 'P':
00072                         kbtotal *= 4;
00073                         break;
00074                 default:
00075                         usage(argv[0], stderr);
00076                         break;
00077                 }
00078         }
00079 
00080         if (argc != 2 || kbtotal == 0)
00081                 usage(argv[0], stderr);
00082 
00083         numchunk = (kbtotal + CHUNK - 1) / CHUNK;
00084         mem = calloc(numchunk, sizeof(*mem));
00085         if (mem == NULL) {
00086                 fprintf(stderr, "error allocating initial chunk array\n");
00087                 exit(-1);
00088         }
00089 
00090         alloc = CHUNK;
00091         printf("[%d] allocating %lld kbytes in %u kbyte chunks\n",
00092                getpid(), kbtotal, alloc);
00093         for (i = kballoc = 0; i < numchunk && alloc > 0; i++, kballoc += alloc){
00094                 if (kbtotal - kballoc < alloc)
00095                         alloc = kbtotal - kballoc;
00096 
00097                 while (alloc > 0 && (mem[i] = malloc(alloc * 1024)) == NULL) {
00098                         fprintf(stderr, "malloc(%u) failed (%lld/%lld)\n",
00099                                 alloc * 1024, kballoc, kbtotal);
00100                         alloc /= 2;
00101                 }
00102                 if (alloc == 0)
00103                         break;
00104 
00105                 printf("touching %p ([%lld-%lld]/%lld)\n", mem[i], kballoc,
00106                        kballoc + alloc - 1, kbtotal);
00107                 for (j = 0, tmp = mem[i]; j < alloc; j += 4) {
00108                         for (k = 0, sum = 0; k < 4095; k++, tmp++)
00109                                 sum += *tmp;
00110                         *tmp = sum;
00111                 }
00112         }
00113         if (kballoc == 0)
00114                 exit(-2);
00115 
00116         kbtotal = kballoc;
00117         printf("touched %lld kbytes\n", kballoc);
00118 
00119         alloc = CHUNK;
00120         printf("verifying %lld kbytes in %u kbyte chunks\n", kbtotal, alloc);
00121         for (i = kballoc = 0; i < numchunk; i++, kballoc += alloc) {
00122                 if (kbtotal - kballoc < alloc)
00123                         alloc = kbtotal - kballoc;
00124 
00125                 tmp = mem[i];
00126                 if (tmp != NULL) {
00127                         printf("verifying %p (%lld/%lld)\n",
00128                                tmp, kballoc, kbtotal);
00129                         for (j = 0; j < alloc; j += 4) {
00130                                 for (k = 0, sum = 0; k < 4095; k++, tmp++)
00131                                         sum += *tmp;
00132                                 if (*tmp != sum) {
00133                                         fprintf(stderr, "sum %x != %x at %p\n",
00134                                                 *tmp, sum, tmp - 4092);
00135                                         rc++;
00136                                 }
00137                         }
00138                 }
00139         }
00140         printf("verified %lld kbytes\n", kballoc);
00141         return rc;
00142 }
